enWisdom: Reward is gained in proportion to the difficulty endured
Hardships are the key to reward

Wisdom: الثَّوَابُ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ وَتَعَالَى عَلَى قَدْرِ الْمُصَابِ [الْمَصَائِبِ‏]
enWisdom: Reward with Allah, the Glorified, is to the extent of the hardship undergone

Wisdom: الثَّوَابُ عَلَى الْمُصِيبَةِ أَعْظَمُ مِنْ قَدْرِ الْمُصِيبَةِ
enWisdom: The reward for [bearing] hardship is greater than the extent of the hardship [itself]

Wisdom: إِنَّ عَظِيمَ الْأَجْرِ مُقَارِنٌ عَظِيمَ الْبَلَاءِ فَإِذَا أَحَبَّ اللَّهُ سُبْحَانَهُ قَوْماً ابْتَلَاهُمْ
enWisdom: Verily great reward accompanies great trials; so when Allah, the Glorified, loves a community, He tries them
Reward descends in proportion to the hardship [that one bears]
To the extent of the hardship, there is reward
The reward is proportionate to the tribulation [endured]

Wisdom: لَنْ يَحْصُلَ الْأَجْرُ حَتَّى يُتَجَرَّعَ الصَّبْرُ
enWisdom: Reward will never be acquired until [the bitter pill of] patience is swallowed
The ‘evil’ that is followed by Paradise is not [really] evil
